intro: Caopia, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus *Ipomoea* and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces edible, tuberous roots that are rich in nutrients. Caopia thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to survive in hot, dry climates. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
